intro: Anerincleistus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which often have a rough texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in inflorescences known as cyathia, a feature common in the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is adapted to arid environments and can thrive in well-drained soils.
